title: My Own True Love (1949) Val lewton Phyllis Calvert
description:
Val Lewton is finally being acknowledged as a master stylist of cinema. Since Apache Drums has been put up, I thought I'd do this as well.

The aftermath of war is quite an important subject nowadays, so it should be interesting to see how people back then dealt with such subjects as war wounds, missing-in-action, overseas prisoners and suchlike. The acting is great;you are advised not to pay toomuch attention to the story - Lewton was out of his depth when not dealing with horror.

At any rate, this is your chance to study the development of a major auteur. (He produced but did not direct this movie).
